document_title: Delayed menstruation (late menstruation): Causes, signs, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_content:
First, the doctor will inquire about the menstrual symptoms the woman is experiencing, and explore her personal medical history and family medical history. Then, the doctor will perform a gynecological examination to check for abnormalities in the reproductive organs. For women who have never had menstruation, the doctor will examine the breasts and genitals to see if the woman is going through normal changes during puberty.
Because menstrual abnormalities are related to hormones in the body, doctors may ask women to take blood tests to get results about whether they are pregnant or not, check ovarian function, Thyroid function, determining the concentration of male hormones, prolactin... in the body.
Depending on the symptoms and blood test results, the doctor may prescribe other tests to increase the accuracy of diagnosis such as ultrasound, computed tomography (CT), and MRI. Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI)…
